div.div: A message from GRANT ELEMENTARY SCHOOL DISTRICT Dear Grant Families, This is Mr. Effa with a Grant School Distance Learning Update. Spring Break officially begins for […]

div.h3: We are committed to the learning and growth of your child. The numbers tell the story.
Amazing, dedicated professionals committed to helping every student succeed!

div.p: Grant Elementary School has consistently scored as a top-performing school in Shasta County. As such, we are prepared to help your child grow and develop toward his or her potential. We partner with parents in this goal and provide a safe, positive, and healthy environment to facilitate learning in every area of academic, physical, emotional, and social development. We ensure that every child has the opportunity to succeed.

p.b: This message is only visible to admins.

div.p:
Problem displaying Facebook posts.

div.h2: Educating the children of Redding and Shasta County

div.p: Grant Elementary School District is a one-school district, serving approximately 700 students in preschool through eighth grade. The school employs 70 people, including a certificated staff of 32 teachers, 2 resource teachers, a speech and language pathologist, a psychologist, a school nurse, a librarian, and administrative and support staff. Grant encourages the active involvement of parents and community members through various programs. Every effort is made to prepare the children of Redding and Shasta County for the future.
